channel.title: [Delta]Slayer help
channel.description: I finally found the slayer master that gives out task, so I custom the task like put men in easy task, yet when I kill a man and then check how much I have left it says the same number "44"...I really don't know what to do how why my character's kills aren't counting

item.title: [Delta]Slayer help
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

[quote=“mista pnut, post:6, topic:459925”]I’m an idiot eh? Let’s run through this.

“I kill a man and then check how much I have left it says the same number”
The fix to this is that you have no method stating that when you have a kill that it must subtract one, so I gave you one. So 1) either you obviously don’t know what the fuck the error is, or 2) you did what I said and you’re mad cause I called you out.

The reason it can only be those two options?
It doesn’t matter how many times you list an ID in the same array, or two different arrays as long as they don’t contradict. Those two arrays don’t contradict each other (and they technically can, you will not get an error via compiling, but you will see an issue when running the program)since they are just lists that are picked from randomly from.[/quote]
no you gave me the wrong code i don’t have “[i]”

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta]Slayer help
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

I’m an idiot eh? Let’s run through this.

“I kill a man and then check how much I have left it says the same number”
The fix to this is that you have no method stating that when you have a kill that it must subtract one, so I gave you one. So 1) either you obviously don’t know what the fuck the error is, or 2) you did what I said and you’re mad cause I called you out.

The reason it can only be those two options?
It doesn’t matter how many times you list an ID in the same array, or two different arrays as long as they don’t contradict. Those two arrays don’t contradict each other (and they technically can, you will not get an error via compiling, but you will see an issue when running the program)since they are just lists that are picked from randomly from.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta]Slayer help
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

[quote=“mista pnut, post:4, topic:459925”]Holy fuck. Do you pay attention?

Add men to your NPCHandler class with the code I gave you. You’ll need to replace the IDS and remove the Double XP and newSlayer, if not you’ll get errors.[/quote]
Your an idiot i fixed all I did was replace the men from high task with corp beast and it works fine…

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta]Slayer help
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

Holy fuck. Do you pay attention?

Add men to your NPCHandler class with the code I gave you. You’ll need to replace the IDS and remove the Double XP and newSlayer, if not you’ll get errors.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta]Slayer help
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

[quote=“mista pnut, post:2, topic:459925”]I’ll give you a code of mine that I have that includes double XP and something I have implemented called newSlayer, you’ll have to remove them both. Otherwise, you could use this. It goes inside of your NPCHandler class.

if (npcs[i].npcType == 103 && temp.taskID == 103) {//ghost if(server.slayerDoubleXP){ temp.addSkillXP(800 , 18); } if(!server.slayerDoubleXP){ temp.addSkillXP(400, 18);//40 kills = 16k xp } temp.taskAmount -= 1; if (temp.taskAmount == 0 || temp.taskAmount == 1) { temp.taskID = -1; temp.taskAmount = -1; temp.sM("You have completed your task. Talk to Vannaka to get a new one."); temp.newSlayer += 1; } }[/quote]

so reason its on men? i just killed a a green dragon…might it be becaue i put men in low task and high task

[code] public int[] lowTask = { 1265, 1267, 90, 1616, 2, 17, 9, 19 };
public int[] mediumTask = { 112, 117, 1582, 1338, 941 };
public int[] highTask = { 2 };
public int taskID = -1;
public int taskAmount = -1;
public int pkPoints = 0;
public int kills;
public int deaths;
public int randomLowTask()
{
return lowTask[(int) (Math.random() * lowTask.length)];
}

public int randomMediumTask() 
{
	return mediumTask[(int) (Math.random() * mediumTask.length)];
}

public int randomHighTask() 
{
	return highTask[(int) (Math.random() * highTask.length)];
}[/code]

men are npcid=2

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta]Slayer help
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

I’ll give you a code of mine that I have that includes double XP and something I have implemented called newSlayer, you’ll have to remove them both. Otherwise, you could use this. It goes inside of your NPCHandler class.

if (npcs[i].npcType == 103 && temp.taskID == 103) {//ghost if(server.slayerDoubleXP){ temp.addSkillXP(800 , 18); } if(!server.slayerDoubleXP){ temp.addSkillXP(400, 18);//40 kills = 16k xp } temp.taskAmount -= 1; if (temp.taskAmount == 0 || temp.taskAmount == 1) { temp.taskID = -1; temp.taskAmount = -1; temp.sM("You have completed your task. Talk to Vannaka to get a new one."); temp.newSlayer += 1; } }

Read full topic
